turns.text: # of caloriesfor 1 cand yginger ?

Hi.Melissa. Each Natural Ginger Tummy Drops has 10 calories and if you are a diabetic.3 carbs. It's directions say to take a maximum of 8 pieces a day. Remember this is not like eating hard candy, it is a supplement. So it also says keep away from children so they don't confuse it with hard candy. I used two while flying partly cause my mouth was dry and I wanted assurance I wouldn't get sick, all I did was let it melt in my mouth. I drink diet Ginger ale all the time, yet I hate gingerbread cookies, gingersnap type, these did not have a strong flavor to them. I don't know if I mentioned I went on a short cruise, which the crew said it was the roughest the seas had been in 6 months, I ended up giving some to two employees because they were getting seasick and they helped them too.Hope I answered enough for you, if not ask anything about them, I will answer again. Thanks. Pat

If I use this for my ball python's UTH, do I still need a thermometer on this side of the tank or just the cool side?

I use it for my rainbow boa and still use a thermometer on that side and another one on the cool side plus a hygrometer. The thermometer is just to be able to double check the temp to make sure it is correct.
Would I be able to cut out a pattern on plywood with this. Would it easily follow curves etc

No, It will only do straight line cuts. You'll need either a scroll saw or a jig saw to follow curved patterns. Scroll saw is table mounted and can follow tight radius curves. Jig saw can be table-mounted or hand held and can cut curves of larger radius. For either saw type, to cut tight radii cuts, you'll want a narrow blade (tip of tooth to back edge), for larger radii or straight line cuts, a wider blade is better.

I'm a real beginner/plan to purchase this for my son so we can both explore the night sky, etc. Is it really easy to setup?/How long will it take?

It's super easy to set up, although it is a plastic housing and adjustment knobs, so it will be touchy to focus just right. The tripod is super cheap, and you will need to invest in something that is heavy and has better manipulation controls than what this ships with. I will say though, the telescope itself is very clear and provides a pretty decent picture. I don't feel that I got a bad deal on it at all and have used it a lot over the last year and some months. Again, the tripod is cheap, but for the price you can't go wrong. Oh, and the carry bag is awesome.

I would get one except for all the negative reports about hard starting. It appears the "Hyper Coil" fixes that, but it doesn't come standard?

All I can say is "that I have had NO problems with mine". BUT: Like an 2 cyl. engine. Always use fresh gas. Gas that is older than 30 days, will over time foul up the carburetor. When you store it leave gas in it WITH gas stabilizer. This way the gaskets won't dry rot. And you will be fine. An electric start systems will fail. IF you over heat the starter.Info from ex mechanic. Good luck.

How much can you cook with one can?

Have not really timed it, but at about one hour if at full blast and weather is above 50 degrees. Last week one can lasted me 3 days -- that included heating water for at least 10 cups of coffee. has anyone used this on firmer veggies such as white potatoes, turnips, or parsnips? Or would the julienne side be for softer veggies only?

I used it on a yam (sweet potato) and it worked fine. I did use a glove to hold it so I wouldn't cut myself. Cut a piece off a rounded veggie so it "sits" more firmly on your cutting board. The first slice of the peeler was hard but it got progressively easier.
Will this work on a 1973 Schwinn continental? Or any other road bike for that matter?

It doesn't look like your bike has the eyelets on top of the front forks to screw the legs to. I went to Home Depot to purchase some metal clamps with rubber on them (electrical department) to attach the legs to the front fork. It worked fine. I carry a 9 lb dog in the basket and the clamps didn't slip. You can go to www.waldsports.com and contact them.

I am upgradig my PC. How does this processor compare to Intel Core-i5 3350P Quad-Core Processor 3.1 Ghz 6 MB Cache LGA 1155 which I'm considering?

Going with this CPU from the I5 would be a small downgrade. If your looking to upgrade onto AMD go with at least a FX 6300 or better If you have the socket to fit. The FX 6300 is a 6 core if you can afford the 8xxx series ( 8 core), that's even better. This is a great CPU but in all honestly it would be a slight downgrade from the i5 you have now.
